Hoi

I'm Zinzy Waleson, a designer and facilitator from Amsterdam. I build digital products and resonant queer spaces. Zinzy.website is a digital garden; a growing collection of loosely-related notes on a wide variety of subjects, maintained in public.

Changelog

  • May 3, 2022 08:12
    Replied to My IndieWebCamp experience

    Great work on setting up your first personal website, Deborah, and welcome to the IndieWeb! Watching my personal Internet heroes help you wade into the waters of independent web publishing was so refreshing for me. Not all corners of the Internet are welcoming to new faces, but I hope you had as great a time as I had at our first IndieWebCamp!

  • May 1, 2022 08:30
    Liked Tollwerk Farbsystem
  • April 30, 2022 00:00

    As the lines between the nature of what I publish here begin to slowly blur, I want to remind myself:

    • Any temporal information is usually best stored in the Changelog
    • While any note on a topic, however big or small and however vague of detailed, should be in Notes
    • And any note the main subject of which is a title of sorts should go in the Library
Changelog

Notes

I keep notes so that I can link and think. They contain soft stances, lived experiences, and critical notes on the things I hold dear. Its contents are subject to change. Why don't you try:

  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Rotterdam
  • Mentoring
Notes

Library

I keep a list of things I listen to, watch, or read, and sometimes share some thoughts on how I interpreted or appreciate a story. You can start with these:

  • Titanic
  • City of God
  • The Shawshank Redemption
Library

Connect

I'm not on social media, but I love receiving email.
